授業目的:
The objective of this course is to introduce the students the theory of portfolio management and its practical applications.

The theoretical component of the course will look into how investment managers select securities for their portfolios as well as how these securities are combined to construct portfolios.

The practical/applications sections of the course will provide an overview of portfolio design, risk management, benchmarking and evaluation of manager performance, as well as the manager's fiduciary duty with respect to their clients.
到達目標:
By the end of this course, students will have an understanding of how to select securities that are part of a portfolio, as well as how these securities are selected to construct portfolios that are designed to satisfy an investment mandate. Students will also become aware of the practical issues faced when constructing portfolios and selecting investment managers.

Students will also gain exposure to the current portfolio management industry. In particular, students will understand the types of organizations involved in the industry, their respective roles, and the types of portfolios they manage.

授業方法:
Hy-Flex.
Lectures, course assignments, and final presentation.
Face-to-Face Format. However, depending on the infection situation of COVID-19, there is a possibility of changing to Online Format: Simultaneous and Two-way.

第1回:
Overview of Asset Management
Asset Managers, Plan Sponsors/Investors
Types of Investment Funds
Recent trends in the industry
- GPIF and the pension system in Japan
- ESG, Technology, Regulations
第2回:
The portfolio approach to investing:
Types of investor characteristics and their needs.
- defined contribution/benefit pension plans.
- the portfolio management process;
- investment policy statement: its components, investment constraints of liquidity, time horizon,
- tax concerns, legal and regulatory factors, and unique circumstances
- performance calculation, attribution and evaluation.
第3回: The portfolio approach to investing - continued
第4回:
Risk -
- definition of risk.
- features of a risk management/governance framework and its efficacy.
- risk tolerance/budgeting and its effects on risk management.
- financial and non-financial sources of risk and their interaction.
- methods to measure and modify risk exposures.
- quantitative measures of risk.
第6回:
Multifactor Models
Arbitrage pricing theory assumptions & multifactor models.
Arbitrage: opportunities for and their existence.
Calculating the expected return on an asset, based on its factor exposures, and the factor risk premiums.
Types of factor models: macroeconomic/fundamental/statistical.
Sources of active risk. Interpretation of tracking error, and Information Ratio (IR).
Describe uses of multifactor models and interpret the output of analyses based on multifactor models;
Potential benefits of considering multiple risk dimensions when modeling asset returns.
第8回:
Active Portfolio Management
Describe how value added by active management is measured
Calculate and interpret the information ratio and contrast it to the Sharpe ratio
State and interpret the fundamental law of active portfolio management including its component terms, transfer coefficient, information coefficient, breadth, and active risk
Explain how the information ratio may be useful in investment manager selection and choosing the level of active portfolio risk
Compare active management strategies and evaluate strategy changes in terms of the fundamental law of active management
Strengths and limits of the fundamental law of active management
第10回: An overview of Investment Research Methodology
第11回:
Short Student Presentations - Investment Research
Students will be required to give a short presentation of an investment research topic. It is expected that this assessment will provide students insights into the methods and thought processes behind investment research in practical terms.
第12回: Short Student Presentations - Investment Research continued
第13回: Student Presentations - Asset Management Case Studies
第14回:
Student Presentations - Asset Management Case Studies continued
